title: Corn Husk Bag
creator: Unknown
description: Cornhusk bag with repeating green conifer tree design on one side, and a geometric square design in green, orange, blue, red, pink, and purple on the other. Leather handles.
subject: Bags
citation: Corn Husk Bag. Hallie Ford Museum of Art, https://willametteart.pastperfectonline.com/webobject/1618F43E-0758-40BB-9500-121802155937. 2017.026.040

title: Beaded Bag
creator: Wasco Artist
description: The design on this bag juxtaposes figural representations of people and horses, suggesting a scene of work or ritual activity. The weaver reimagined a widespread style of decorated pouches used for tools or ritual paraphernalia with details such as the bricked geometric diamonds and zigzags. The bagâ€™s embellishment reflects artistic experimentation and innovation in the face of dramatic changes that occurred by the 1850s, including the imposition of the reservation system in the Lower Columbia River.
subject: Beaded Bags
citation: Wasco artist, Beaded Bag, ca. 1860, The Charles and Valerie Diker Collection of Native American Art, Possibly made in Oregon, United States; Possibly made in Washington, United States, 2021.434.22

title: Basket
creator: Grand Ronde Artist
description: Woven basket with lid and handle. The body of the basket has a climbing spiral pattern; the handle is composed of two overlapping braids. The base of the basket is round but the lid is square-sided, with a braided edge.
subject: Woven Baskets
citation: Grande Rhonde artist, Basket, 1920, Gift of Margaret McGregor, COPYRIGHT RESTRICTIONS, 2010.055.009

title: Berry Bag
creator: Umatilla artist
description: Bag made out of commercial dyes, buckskin, and cotton by a Umatilla artist depicting a Native person.
subject: Buckskin Bag
citation: Umatilla artist, Berry Bag, 1940, commercial dyes, buckskin, and cotton, The Elizabeth Cole Butler Collection, no known copyright restrictions, 2012.92.21

title: Apron
creator: Southern Oregon Coast artist
description: Apron made out of beargrass, leather, and glass beads by Southern Oregon Coast artist.
subject: Apron
citation: Southern Oregon Coast artist, Apron, ca. 1850, beargrass, leather, and glass beads, Gift of the Harris Family descendants, Port Orford, Oregon, no known copyright restrictions, 2005.73.28
